reviewText:
I finally beat the game. The Escapades, Mecha-Naruto Story, The Tournament and the Ally Events. (But not all of the Challenges and Jobs, those are mindless Time-wasters.)

Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolution was the most entertaining filler in my opinion. It made me laugh, cry (Literally..), and also made me.. very angry at times (that wore off after a while).

The first thing i started with when i got this game was the ninja escapades. The anime scenes were quite entertaining, and felt like an actual episode of Naruto Shippudden. I like how they got rid of the quick time events for the cutscenes, i just wanted to sit back and relax after a fight i had won, I got that.. and more.
The Akatsuki Origins were fun and easy to blast through, and it was fun to watch the cutscenes that played between each fight. The story of the Akatsuki origins in this game starts at the point where Deidara and the rest were just getting recruited and not before the Hanzo incident. Itachi and Kisame's joining wasn't included as well.
The Itachi/Shisui Storyline was Incredibly entertaining to play through and watch, revealing facts and expanding on who Shisui was, and it includes some bonding between characters that.. I hate to say it, made me cry.. The good feels, ya know?
After you finish the first two escapades, you are rewarded a short episode with team Minato, with Kushina.

Now to the Mecha Naruto Story.. *sigh* Basically the type of story that was used in this has been dragged through countless arks and fillers.. Mecha naruto feels like an outsider, a freak and alone, and he feels just like Naruto did in the begining Bla Bla Bla. I'm not sorry for being harsh towards this story with Mecha Naruto, My feels were depleted after the legit Gaara story. It got less appealing to watch when it was recycled for Sora and Isaribi.

Finally we get to the Tournament part. Basically, you mash buttons untill you win, in a 4 person arena where you collect orbs that Drop when you hit enemies and drop boxes.. Have fun repeating that untill you get that Ultimate Steam Achievements!!.. the game awards you small accesories that you can't equip unless you're playing as a character who's wearing their main costume.. Ultimate Customisation my a-.. sorry.

While I enjoyed the Ninja Escapades A Lot, the rest was mildly entertaining at best.
Because I played the Rise of a Ninja and The Broken Bond Games on the Xbox 360. I was not pleased with the free roam.. it was an annoyance, it was not fun, it was slow, it was lifeless, with the most boring side missions that included running from point A to B with fights thrown in.

I'd give this game a 6/10. My scoring relies on the fun i had in the ninja escapades, the character roster, the lazy attempt at trying to appeal to the free roam thing they forgot that people wanted, and the Ultimate team moves that were thrown in for awesome fan service.

My suggestion for the next game is to bring in some F@$%ing Voice acting!! This isn't a PS1/PSP game, Jeez. Pressing the prompt button to get the next speech bubble was Irritating, I was interested in what the characters had to say but in this case, the characters were hollow and without F@$%ING VOICE!!!!
And please expand on the Free Roam (as in exploration and worthwhile bonuses, similar to UNS1 and The Xbox 360 Exclusives), you got the fighting mechanics down 100% and i am Greatful for that!! you can put some of your efforts elsewhere too now!!

reviewText: This is not a bad game. But compared to the other naruto games it sucks. The different fighting types makes the characters stripped of their powers and makes you feel limited to what you can truly do with the character you're playing as. The counter mechanic needs to be taken out in storm 4, it ruins the flow of the game and all you need to really do is spam that counter to win. Plus, they only added maybe 12-15 new characters,the rest are the exact same characters from the previous games with unedited movesets that make it seem like you just bought the same game twice but with barely any content added. Now finally the 4 player tournament mode is just a mess, it's hard not to get frustrated to do one simple combo on one of the fighters without getting attacked by OP characters in the tournament every 5 seconds. This type of problem doesn't occur until you get to the B ranked matches in world tournament. Once again the online services are mediocre since there is lag constantly in every fight you play against someone in, this is dissapointing because you think that CC2 would learn from storm 3 full burst, but if anything the online is the same if not worse. This is by far the worst storm game, I'll only play it because there is literally no one playing online for storm 3 anymore. All I will say now is just skip this game, wait a little bit, and get storm 4.

reviewText:
As a Naruto fanboy, I enjoy this game very much. However, there are many problems with it, and I had to debate whether I should thumbs up this game, or thumbs down it. First, let's start with the pros:

+ Stays true to the anime/manga
+ Much better balancing than Storm 3
+ A fun fighting game that can potentially give you 75+ hours of gameplay, if you're committed enough to online battles

There are not that many, as you can see. Now, lets move on to the neutral arguments:

= There is no story focus in this game, as the story doesn't get you through even 3 hours of gameplay
= Not that easy for someone new to the game, as COM's can only make you so good, and many people online are heavily experienced
= You will most likely need a controller to achieve a certain level of mastery in this game (Keyboard doesn't cut it)

And finally, let's look at the long list of cons

- EXTREMELY BAD LAG ISSUES WHEN PLAYING ONLINE ; Almost 90% of your matches will have some input delay, and you will encounter many Transmitting matches" as well (This is when your online battle will constantly be interrupted by a dialogue prompt that freezes your match for ~0.5 seconds. It reads
recommended: can appear every second\n- Many bugs ; for example
hoursPlayed: many peoples' games crash upon encountering a certain event (Sage Mode Hashirama going into True Awakening mode)\n- Almost no one plays this game anymore on the PC
voteText: so online lobbies are desolate wastelands\n- Not enough special team ultimate jutsu ; Guy and Lee don't have one
helpfulPercent: Hinata and Neji don't have one
votesHelpful: etc.\n- Character selection is extremely repetitive ; There are around 5 playable Naruto's/Sasuke's
votesTotal: but we aren't able to play as Ginkaku/Kinkaku
votesFunny:
or all of the 7 Swordsmen of the Mist
- Peer to peer connection ; We need some dedicated servers
- Not a cheap game ; It's 50 Euro and 45 if you have the previous game (Storm 3)

So there. Now you decide for yourself. I personally enjoy this game very much
commentsCount: but only because I'm a Naruto fanboy. If you aren't a diehard Naruto fan
column16: I would probably wait for a big sale or just pass on this one.\n\nTLDR ; If you're a diehard Naruto fan
column17: you will probably enjoy this game. However
column18: be prepared for lag issues
column19: trouble finding matches online
column20: and wishing for more characters in the roster. If not
column21: pass on it and wait for them to (hopefully) fix all of these errors in the next game."

reviewText:
Do you like story?
Epic fights?
Awesome cutscenes?
Adaptable fighting mechanics, simple yet effective?
Go and play Naruto Shippuden Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst. Revolution is NOT worth your time if this is what you want. There is minimal story, minimal variation in characters, and the one cool thing about the game (1v1v1v1) Isn't even multiplayer, so no 2v2 awesomeness. Mecha-Naruto is Ech at best, and not worth the extra time put in to unlock it. In the other game the awesome fights are set up FOR you, and these fights have choices, extra mid-fight scenes, etc.
In general, the other game is more fun. I played this for a few hours and got VERY bored, whereas Full Burst on ps3 I had 100%ed. And what the hell is up with most characters? They all fight very similarly and are grouped into different classes, as I see it - ranged, close combat or OP-as-â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥-kills-everything. Balancing was done, but it sorta takes away some of the fun.
And the part that pains me most? Â£40. Wasted. It should be around Â£25, maybe Â£20. Â£30 at a push, not more. Spend Â£15 on Full Burst - or less on a sale - and have a WAY better time.

reviewText:
I am so amazed by this game. It has the most enjoying combat system by my likes. It's fast paced, while keeping it simple so anyone can join the combat. The ideas for combos and landing the hits are well implemented, along with the realistic hitboxes.

The new features are also funny and I count them as an improvement from Ninja Storm 3. Also the addition of a single button dodge (LT) is coming in very handy and it's something that was really missing from the previous title. I'm still new in the game and I will post again with more details.

The big con here, is that the game doesn't have a story mode. BUT! Did anyone complained when we were playing Street Fighter, Dragon Ball or similar games about the story mode? We repeated the same fights over and over again, until our thumbs were hurting so much, that we'd stop doing combos!

For those that look into a combat game, I highly recommend this. Therefor for those who want to have an 80 hours gameplay-story game, better try elsewhere.

See you online everyone!
Sincerely,
eThi

reviewText:
Worst Naruto game I've ever played, seems like something they just rushed out onto Steam just to say they made another Naruto game, to be honest, it's like a gigantic work in progress.

It has it's cool moments despite the completely stupid and cliche storyline they pulled out of their asses with someone nobody's ever heard of building a robotic clone of Naruto for God knows why, but the fact that the game has toasters for servers and there aren't those amazing gigantic boss fights, (or any boss fights at all, not counting the one with Kyuubi because that's just Mecha-Naruto in his awakening and true awakening) really takes the one thing that made Naruto games fun.

(Not going to bring up how Shisui's standard combo crashes the game in single player, yet it's perfectly fine online.)

If I could get my money back from buying this game, I would.

In short: This game sucks. Wait for Ultimate Ninja Storm 4.

reviewText: Major online lag, lack of story and a feeling that there should be more content other than the massive amount of characters keeps this game from being more than ok to the general public. I can already tell you I only love this game because of the Naruto part of it. The Ninja World Tournament mode and Mecha Naruto story were both short, had a small amount of fights, and weren't too intresting. The ninja escapades (OVAs) had very few fights across the three, but I suppose that makes sense. They should've really just been extras you could've unlocked, like the ultimate jutsu videos. They had a nice story though...despite lasting around 40 minuets for all 3 combined.\nThe actual combat featured in the game is extremley simple but fun in my opinon. If you like hitting the same few buttons in same manner for each character, you'll find the game fun. Don't go looking for Tekken or BlazBlue levels of complexity levels here. The character  roster spans over 100 characters, but each plays exactly like each other with few differences. For example, one combo might send the reciever farther into the air than another character, but it won't make too much of a difference. The only major difference between each character is their jutsu and it doesn't help too much to differentiate every character that well. Why should I play as Asuma instead of Mecha-Naruto? They're exactly the same for almost everything but one move." Online is very

reviewText:
I had been looking forward to this game for a while seeing i wanted more characters then 3 had to offer it all came through ofcourse without any ''real'' story mode, but i wanted it for the multiplayer.

And then it hit me like a truck...
The multiplayer is broken for allot if not most of its users, no matter what monster pc you might have or how fast your ISP is if you got bad luck your not playing this online.

The problem being a 1 to 2 second input lagg when playing online, as to wich current responce has been ''stop trying to play it on a toaster''
The machine i wanted to play this on [hooked up to a tv to act as a ''console'' but with decent gfx and modding ability when it applys to said game] is a simple amd fx 9590 @ 5.2ghrz with 24gb ram 2100mhz and a hd7970 ghrz + hd7990.
The game runs fine never an issue multiplayer has a 2 second input lagg for me aswell no matter the gfx settings or connection strength of me and my opponent [running 210mbit download 20mbit upload wired]

Untill a fix or update arrived i completely recommend to ignore this game and not run the risk of having a little fighting game with no real single player stuck in your steam list.

reviewText:
If you've already Bought and played Storm 2, Storm Generations and Storm 3......then I wouldn't really recommend getting this game since there's very little new implementations in this game.

But I'll consider my pros and cons for this game.

Pros:
- Character customisation is a great way to customise your favs (even better if there were more customisable items)
- Network clone training, I personally liked these as it's a good way to train you're favs online.
-  The Ninja Tournament is fun (for a while)

Cons:
- The Mecha Naruto Story felt like a completely unnecessary addition to the game (+ the character)
- Combination Ultimate jutsus - this is a great implement however, only a select few characters can use it instead of ALL OF THEM -_-. I was hoping for Team 8 CUJ, Team 10 CUJ etc. Some CUJ's have characters that have never fought as a team or in combination (e.g. Kushina and Minato/ Konohamaru and Iruka etc.)
- Old Characters still have outdated movesets (e.g. Kiba still has 3 headed Cerburus missing from his moveset, They still have the same UJ's from storm 2)
- Changing the game mechanics where you have to choose between Awakening and Ultimate jutsu mode is a downgrade IMO.

Neutral:
- I generally didn't care about the Ninja escapades - because the stories and characters involved don't appeal to me.

Other Improvements:
- Only Team 7 and female characters seem to get fanservice dlc costumes......I really want to see new Kiba costumes (for example)

Overall I would rate the game a 4.5/10....If you've played the previous installments, I wouldn't recommend getting this. But If this is your first storm game then it would be more intriguing for our first play

reviewText:
Locked at 30 fps.

It freezes up during cutscenes frequently. This would be bearable if I could atleast fast forward my way to where it froze the last time. But you cannot fast forward or rewind the cutscenes.  This is the worst part for me. The cutscenes are really cool for a Naruto fan, they are drawn in the style of the anime and show a lot of neat stuff that was never fully developed in the show,  and I can't get through them. It's mildly infuriating. I just Rage quit after trying to get through this one scene with Itachi and Shisui 3 times.

If the game ran at 60 fps and didn't constantly freeze up during the god damn cutscenes it would be great. How hard can it be for somebody who creates video games to make a video that doesn't freeze up? wtf? Unless this game gets some updates I wouldn't recommend it, even to a huge Naruto fan, especially for $50.

reviewText:
This was a huge disappointment for me.
The gameplay just feels so shallow and slow, all characters play nearly the same, and having to choose between transforming and doing a ultra special attack? Really?
This feels like a serious downgrade from the old 2d fighting games on the ps2.
There should also be a bigger focus on the actual melee/ special attacks instead of wasting buttons on all those items. Most of the time they are rather annoying and boring.
The completely uninspired tournament being the main game mode doesn't help either.

reviewText:
I would like to pinpoint a few things to anyone thinking of buying this game, the first being that I am a fan of the series.

With that in mind, it would not take much for the game to please me, however it failed miserably. I made a review for Storm 3 which showed how happy I was and everything right that the developers made, and some of it still applies here.

What changed, is the fact that PC has been completly left behind by whoever is responsible for this series. There is a bug at character selection that crashes your game, EVERY SINGLE TIME. One year after release and nobody gave a f*** about fixing it. Tried everything even support forums, but after almost 1 year nobody patched this.

Do not buy this, it is unplayable.

reviewText:
It's hardly bad, by any stretch of the imagination, but it is largely underwhelming when compared to any other entry in the series. My biggest qualms are that they removed Jutsu clashes (yes, I'm one of those peole) and that the four player mode is... well, single player. And, in all honesty, it's not very fun; it largely comprises of getting the most hits in a round instead of taking out each opponent one by one, which, in a local party match, would be a good way to keep all the players playing throgh to the end. But again: it's single player. The design decision is really pointless, and it basically composes the entire NInja World Tournament. Not to mention that the free roaming island it takes place on is giant and lifeless.

I think the announcer dialogue is probably the worst option. Not so much that it exists, just that it's terrible and doesn't actually react to anything that's happening. My personal favorite: I see. The strategy is to finish this quickly." Over and over again.

The character roster is definitely formidable
date: with costume options for all of them
hoursPlayed: the core fighting gameplay is pretty much as good as ever (minus the clashes)."

reviewText: If you are a fan of Naruto like me,  then you'll love this game. My only problem is it's story mode is kinda non-existent, But this is definetly a good one to get.

reviewText:
If you've read any of the other reviews then you know that this game doesn't continue any part of the story; or really, there isn't any campaign mode at all. So if your only knowledge before buying this game is everything steam presents you on the store page, then you're being lied to. The video and the screenshots show you the progression of the story (like, literally the next events to come along in the series); but all you get is the same fighting system from Full Burst 3 mixed with a tournament gimmick.

The Good Bits:
-The fighting in the game is really fun.
-You can play with up to 4 players
-There are lots of characters.
-You can experience small story bits like The Creation of the Akutski"

The Bad Bits:
-The fighting is fun
date: but that's because it's the SAME THING FROM FULL BURST 3!\n-The slight changes they've made to the fighting system have made it worse than Full Burst 3. Instead of having full access to all of your abilities
recommended: they're split amongst the "Drive System". (i.e. With Neji
hoursPlayed: in full burst 3 you could activate Byakugan at the cost of your chakra gauge draining. In Revolution you have to choose a drive system meaning
voteText: either you get to have your Kekkei Genkai or your ultimate attack). This a huge downgrade from the previous game
helpfulPercent:
and there's NOTHING positive to gain from this change.
-On Steam the game is shamelessly sold under the false impression that you're continuing the story. There's nothing stating that it's just a fighting game with a tournament mode and little else to it; but the video footage and screenshots sell you on the image of what clearly happens next in the storyline.

Final Thoughts:
Don't waste your time getting Revolution. If you don't have Full Burst 3 then I would highly recommend getting that and forgetting that this game even exist.
If you have Full Burst 3 then don't waste $50 on this game unless:
1) You have $50 that you're just dying to waste on something

reviewText:
Bought the game whilst on the Winter Sale, whooping -40% off!

First impressions are: lacking story mode. You get three different arcs, one which is very short (Obito and Kushina). However, the other two were well thought out in terms of story and gameplay alike. Anime omitted the parts, but ties in nicely with it! I am yet to try out Mecha Naruto!


PROS:
- Ultimate Jutsu, Awakening and Drive Modes; definitely spice up the variety
- New characters
- Clever way to unlock new characters
- Survival Mode seems to be better than in Storm 3 (FullBurst)
- Different Ultimates, depending on whom you team up with
- Different cutscenes, depending on the opponent
- Ninja World Tournament looks promising so far

CONS:
- Lacking story mode, compared to Storm 3


However, at the time of writing this, I am yet to unlock all the characters, finish off rest of the Survival challanges, and try the Online Mode, hence the short review.

EDIT1: Finished all the Survival Modes, unlocking all the characters in the process. Quite pleased with the amount of available characters.

reviewText:
MILD SPOILERS:

I'm such a big fan of all the Naruto games down to the old Ultimate Ninja's, Chronicles, etcetera. My favorite was Storm 3 by far and I had VERY high expectations for this game. So far I have about 2 hours in and I tried every type of gameplay. The world tournament seems EXTREMELY bland, the story mode" for the akatsuki was extremely repetative. (Oh go here. Confront them. They deny it. Fight. You overwhelmingly win. They join from their own interests.).

All said and done the new features in this game are nothing to look at. Now getting down to the core gameplay most people end up playing which is free battles of all types. You're going to get what you expect which is a traditional Ultimate Ninja game
date: but the ultimate justus seem VERY anti-climatic and dry. Using a character like Pain and having such a mediocre jutsu is a laugh. I do think you can unlock more through playing parts of the game though
recommended: have yet to get to those parts.\n\nOverall
hoursPlayed: disappointed with my experience so far
voteText: but I'm not giving up in the game. As a fan of Naruto it takes a lot to really through me off for a game and there's still fun to be had here. Just don't go into this game expecting the AWESOMELY cinematic story more experience and thrilling free-battles we got out of Storm 3."

reviewText:
Bad port. The online sucks (very laggy), capped at 30FPS, graphical bugs. It has DLC for costumes that should've been in the game since the beginning. No Juubito, Juubidara, 7 Swordsmen and The Silver Brothers (Kinkaku and Ginkaku)

Ranked Matches are full of Tryhards. (Deidara Spammers, Puppet Masters and Giant Awakening Spammers) Some supports are VERY annoying.(ANKO) As I said before, the online is very laggy. Do NOT play this game online without an Ethernet Cable. If you want some solid matches, don't go on Ranked and play Player Matches.

The only good thing about this game is the modding community.
Do NOT buy this game at full price, wait for a price drop or something. LOL

reviewText:
Spam range attacks, pick range characters, have support that also spams range.

Online netcode is VERY bad.

Nothing new is offered to the story.

Combos are too simplistic for my taste.  If your familar with any of the DBZ budakai series then you can easily play this game and beat it, no sweat.

SOO MANY LOADING SCREENS... Porting to PC, you should at least take into the account there's more RAM than a console.

Crashes occasionally when trying to make character selections.

Tries to extend gameplay time by having slow travel times between areas. If there wasn't any loading/traveling you could probably beat this game in one sitting.

I'm not against OpenGL but DirectX has come along way...

Each character has 2 unique Ninjutsu moves and about 4 different combos and 1 unique grab. Some of them have unique support with Ultimate Ninjutsu. That said, the characters only favor either being direct or indirect aka range.

Small reasons you might want to have this game:
It offers local multiplayer. (Only up to two!) Online is 4 players.
It features your favorite characters from the series (almost all of them.)

You do need a controller for a better experience.

reviewText:
Although I did enjoy playing it and the mechanics are better then ever ... it was disappointing personally.

I'm a fan of the show. There's a LOT of characters to play from either Season 1 or Season 2 (shippuden). Nice combos, great music, and even new stuff like fusing your supporting character's ultimate into your main character's ultimate aka a teamwork based finale ultimate. There's even animated cut scenes made by the people who work on the anime themselves, and it goes into the past based on Akatsuki to Obito's childhood. Was great seeing those clips.

But ....

The game falls flat on story mode. You only get three of them which are very short. Then you have the World Championship which involves you hitting your opponents to collect the most orbs. It's kind of pointless and lame to be honest. Online mode has hardly anyone really playing, let alone doing ranking mode, to leaderboard mode. I have great connection but still had difficulty finding anyone to fight against. The rest of the game is lacking on terms of game modes against AI's along the fact there's not much else to it. For a fighting game, it feels it could of been more. I still enjoyed it, yet... overall, it could of been better apart from the mechanics being improved and great cutscenes done in the anime fashion like the show. Not worth getting if you want to play against people online for it's really empty.

column20: a defense of the combos: "There's only 3 combos for each character" is a very poor excuse to overlook this game as a fighter if you really enjoy them. Don't knock it before you try it
column21: and I would reccomend looking at some of the higher-tier online gameplay videos to get a feel for how this can really be played. The 3-combo-system is also all centered around set up. Hit him onto the ground to keep him close
column22: knock him back to gain some distance
column23: throw him into the air to make him vulnerable. It's all about the movement.\nAlso
column24: many of the combos have some very tricky things throughout them.\nFor example
column25: some characters throw ranged weapons at specific points in their combo which can then be used to catch your opponent and rush in for a combo. In addition
column26: each of those combos have particular moments within the moves which can be interrupted by "rushing" in at the intervals which may then be counter-countered by your opponent if they read your rush correctly.\n\nIf you're really that critical
column27: I would even reccomend simply pirating this game and playing it on single matches and then teams with a friend. You will more than likely start to see what you're missing."

reviewText:
well guys im going to just give you quick pros and cons i found about this game.
Pros
the rebalance of characters and of course the type, now the player select one type (ultimate jutsu, drive, awaking), on last naruto the character could have awaking and ultimate jutsu what makes it unbalanced becauase not al characters had awakings.
free for all, the new game mode, basically they tried to have a smash bros obviously failed in my personal opinion it could have be better.
the network clone feature, which is take any character you like, customize it and send it to train, not big deal but is a way for unlocking things.
they added new characters.
world torunament campaign.
Cons
the world tornament gets repetitive and boring.
TONS of loading screens.
lack of story compared to past naruto game, here we have 2 chapters shown as if they were anime episodes, just a few battles.
lack of team combinations (team name and ultimate justsu style, i mean last time i selected 1 hokage and naruto and  i though it would be a combination called will of fire of simething like that, same thing about ultime justsu collaboration, i dont remember right now the characters i played.)
they have repeated characters like naruto, saske, killer be, i mean they could have just 1 naruto in the character selection screen and there you can choose if you want it kurama link, normal, sage, and then choose the justu avaiable according to the selected, this way maybe they could have bring more characters such as Guren (crystal justu, i liked that element i wish i could played her, or like Anko)
the game is for multiplayer 95%, unlocking all content is easy.
if you are looking a game for storytelling this isnt your game, this game is for multiplayer 85%
all of the above is a personal opinion traying to be objective.
i hope it help you guys.

reviewText: Minus the glitch that happens with some laptops and Shisui's neutral combo this game is fantastic! The amount of playable characters adds a significant amount of options to create your own team. The new storm gauge works well with the feel of the game. The choice between Ultimate Jutsu, Awakening, and Drive types are immense. You can play one character on a certain type for a while and then play them on another and it can be a night and day difference. Overall great game, and as long as you adjust for the glitch (you can find the solution on the steam forums) you will have a great time playing it.

reviewText: While I generally recommend this game, I will ask you to take caution; this game does not run well on all PC's, and I am not talking about weaker machines. When I bought this game, I had the same problems I had with Ninja Storm 3 after I upgraded from my old Radeon HD 6950 1GB to a Radeon R9 290 4GB. From what I've gathered, these games do not run well on GPU's with a clockspeed that is too high, and will then run at a framerate as low as 20 FPS at worst. When in a fight, it will vary from 25-30 FPS. This not only means stuttering animation, but a lowered game speed as well, because the game speed is bound to the framerate, as is common practice in fighting games. I recommend this game to anyone with a slightly weaker system. If you DO have a stronger system, and decide to buy the game regardless, there are programs that can fix the problems. If you google ninja storm revolution framerate" you'll find steam threads that can help you
date: although some of the instructions leave out some vital parts
recommended: so keep reading further in the threads."

reviewText:
Note: I only play the Multiplayer of this game, so that is what this review focuses on.

The short:
A very pretty looking casual fighting game, with even more characters stages and jutsus than before. It's not quite as friendly to 'pick-up' and learn though, due to the introduction of several new mechanics. Unless you become very good at mastering the new mechanics, you most likely will not enjoy higher level play in this game.

As it goes for many things, who you play with really makes (or breaks) the game.

The long:

Because I have a lot of complaints about this game I will get the positives out of the way first.

The graphics are crisp and fresh. The new moves and characters really help boost the 'new feel' to the game, even if it's more like UNS 3.5 instead of UNS4. The combos and Ultimate Jutsus are flashier than ever, and the new combo Ultimate system really helps immerse you into the game as the teams go. Because of the new Type-Select system, a lot of the characters which were flat-out bad in Full Burst are now more or less playable and have viable strategies.

Now for my complaints.

Revolution feels like a good game at heart, it seems like it was trying to fix a lot of stuff that was not broken with the last game (Full Burst).  The Type-Select system is a cool novelty, but most of the time I was just wishing they balanced out the Awakenings and Ultimates of all the characters instead of basically resorting to they're all going to be overpowered

reviewText:
Storm Revolution is the 'in-between' Storm title. What I mean by that is that there is no canon story presented like in Storm 3, but a ton of updated characters to play and experiment with and a new 4 way combat mode to tackle.

Pros:
A lot of characters to play with
Mecha-Naruto Story feels like a decent filler arc of the anime
Side stories to play through complete with animated cutscenes
Joint ultimate jutsu!
Cons:
World Tournament mode is a bit repetitive
No fantastic boss battles like in Storm 3
I don't play online so I cannot comment on that game mode.

A main addition is 4 way combat. It's hard to fall one way or another with this mode. It is very fun to have a lot of hectic action on screen at once. However, it can sometimes get too hectic, and with a lacking targetting system you may be taking more hits than you really should.

The Mecha-Naruto story is a fun little story to enjoy. It's not the greatest story you'll ever play but it is enjoyable to play through an entirely new story that isn't presented in the manga or anime. It definitely doesn't hold the game up on it's own but it's a good additional mode.

If you're a fan of the Naruto series, you will find a lot of fantastic fanservice in this game mainly to excite you for the next Storm game. Admittedly, it's also missable if you're not too interested in trying new characters or the new combat system. If you're not a fan, it'll be hard to buy into the series with this title. You're better off starting with Storm 2 (not on PC) or Storm 3.

reviewText: While I generally recommend this game, I will ask you to take caution; this game does not run well on all PC's, and I am not talking about weaker machines. When I bought this game, I had the same problems I had with Ninja Storm 3 after I upgraded from my old Radeon HD 6950 1GB to a Radeon R9 290 4GB. From what I've gathered, these games do not run well on GPU's with a clockspeed that is too high, and will then run at a framerate as low as 20 FPS at worst. When in a fight, it will vary from 25-30 FPS. This not only means stuttering animation, but a lowered game speed as well, because the game speed is bound to the framerate, as is common practice in fighting games. I recommend this game to anyone with a slightly weaker system. If you DO have a stronger system, and decide to buy the game regardless, there are programs that can fix the problems. If you google ninja storm revolution framerate" you'll find steam threads that can help you
date: although some of the instructions leave out some vital parts
recommended: so keep reading further in the threads."

reviewText:
It is indeed revolution! a whole new way of playing the storm series, as a Naruto manga, anime & storm series lover, i'm glad they changed some things around. Picking UJ/Awk/Drive mode is a fair thing to do that needed to be done since a long time ago, having everything at the same time made every character OP'd, but i love how about 85% of the characters have their full potential, just as in the manga and anime.

I see a bunch of people crying about the story mode, i could understand that from first timers, but when i see them whining about Storm 3 being better, then you shouldn't have bought this game in the first place, if you have truly been a storm series fan, you would already know what CC's pattern is.

Storm 1 - Cinematic story line featured
Storm 2 - Cinematic story line featured
Generations - No story mode but a whole bunch of new characters were released & never seen anime content" as well.
Storm 3 - Cinematic story line featured - more new characters.
Revolution - A whole bunch of new characters
date:
with never seen anime content and some extra new changes and features.
Storm 4 - THE MODAFAWKING BOSS OF THE STORMS (2015 very likely) .

Based in that timeline
recommended: we can expect storm 4 to be back to cinematic story line just like storm 1-2-3.\n\nOnce again

reviewText:
The next game in the Storm series of Naruto fighting games, the previous games boasted high graphics, large roster of one hundred different and unique characters, and a good story to boot. This next game in the franchise is going to have all of that ramped up to the max and a ton of new features to set it apart. The previous game was highly modded and this game should end up the same in the end adding many more hours to the hundreds that you will be putting in after picking up this epic game. And with the multilayer mode and many different characters to chose from it is a great game for even people who are not fans of the series, but be warned after playing this game you will be! This game will be taking place around the current Naruto Shippuden subbed episodes and into the manga chapters directly following, so try to skip the cut scenes if you are not far enough in the series yet to avoid spoilers, and many of the battles in the game are from the series but they often will add or take out battles from the series to better fit the game, nothing bad enough to ruin the story for the people who already have scene it but enough to avoid to many major spoilers for new comers. If you wish to start watching or reading now hear are links to the start of the three viewing forms of Naruto.
Dubbed: http://www1.narutospot.net/watch/naruto-1-dubbed/
Subbed: http://www1.narutospot.net/watch/naruto-1/
Manga: http://www.mangapanda.com/93-1-1/naruto/chapter-1.html
But if you want you can start here without any real problems with the story because most of it is explained and most the series is not directly affected by the original but I highly recommend starting from the originals to get the full story, but again none of this is kneaded to play the games an still have a lot of fun while your doing it.
Dubbed: http://www1.narutospot.net/watch/naruto-shippuden-1-dubbed/
Subbed: http://www1.narutospot.net/watch/naruto-shippuden-1/
Manga: http://www.mangapanda.com/93-250-1/naruto/chapter-245.html
All of this is ongoing with the manga about one hundred episodes in chapters longer than the Subbed and subbed about one hundred episodes longer than the dubbed. I have done all three and the only difference between subbed and dubbed content is length but both shows have fillers in them that the manga does not have but are still considered cannon, much like some of the content that will be in this game in the form of flashbacks and other cut scenes. And all of this is still ongoing but saddle the manga is going to end sometime late 2014,leaving the amine to catchup but still giving us marginal content with fillers and there is also a movie and other content coming out not based solely of the manga.

reviewText:
Woo this is a fun game. I say this game evens itself out. World Tournament mode is a thrill, and the Ninja Escapades which is basiclly story mode is entertaining... With a few fights in The Akatsuki Story, two fights in Shisui, and NONE in Obito's which I think is kind of lame. They do offer Free Battle mode, Online Mode, and World Tournament mode outside of the Ninja Escapdes mode though. World Tournament is a four man/woman battle. You start at D rank mode, and work your way up. First match is free for all, and after that you have to hunt down a partner on the tournament island to help you.

edit add: So I just wanted to add I played 15 hours now, and found you can get mecha Naruto story if you beat world tournament the first time, and its highly worth it to seek out accessories if possible. You can make some pretty epic looks. In Free battles you can do League, and Survival mode. There is also a special type system ultimate, Drive, and awakening. Awakening allows for constant awakenings, Ultimate allows use of ultimate, and Drive makes you more interactive with allies, and they often protect you from ultimates. Bringing together allies on your team creates different effects. Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura will get you the three way summon. So basiclly its based on who is on your team that makes the special and yes these specials replace your ultimate jutsu. So becareful cause your characters REAL ultimate might be better.

Its got a good set up so far, and for those of you who are looking for a keyboard layout here is something just for you!
Start: Enter
Back: Right shift
Y: A
A: Space
X: Z
B: X
Left stick click: X
Right stick click: right control
Left back: Q
Right Back: E
Left trigger: W
Right Trigger S
Left stick up: up
Left stick down: down
Left stick left: left
Left stick right: right
Right stick up: T
Right stick down: G
Right stick left: F
Right stick right: H
Dpad up: I
Dpad down: k
Dpad left: j
Dpad right: L

It works for me, and may be abit confusing, but basiclly it will work like...
Q, and E for summoning partners
W for sub jutsu
S for blocking
A for chakra
D for melee
Z for throwing Shuriken
I,J,K,L are your items
F,T,G,H, are your changing target in world tournament moment, or simply turning the camera.
Oh and I forget to mention the space bar becomes your jump button.

Enjoy this amazing game!

reviewText: I'd easily recomend this game based on just the amazing visuals and the fast paced, fluid combat. The added 'special stories' are actually pretty interesting, and I really enjoy the replay value with the tournament mode- In fact, I'll probably be playing for quite a while.\nIf I had a criticism though, like most others posting reviews, is that this is truely not a sequel as we've come to understand the word as- yes, it has many charecters that came out after Ultimate Ninja Storm 3, and Full Burst, but as many are saying, this really just feels like a DLC. For starters, there is no story mode- which, until today, I was lead to believe that there, in fact, would be. I was slightly dissapointed in that fact. For instance, if you bought this game alone and none of the other most recent releases, you'd be missing out on playing the story mode, which I know many people playing this game look foreward too.\nHOWEVER! This review is a recommendation, and not a negative comment. WHILE some of those key elements are missing, this game is still more fun than it's predecesors in gameplay and combat mechanics. The new formation modes are a fresh take on the traditional 'use the biggest jutsu first' situations- in fact, there's a formation that will cancel out those huge jutsu's! Beyond that, the animations are visually stunning as always, and the huge charecter roster is quite impressive. Besides, I've already heard that they were going to add more, of course in DLC's, but I in fact will buy them. While it's not the game I was looking for, I will play it eagerly- I preordered it 5 weeks ago damnit, and I'm not gonna stop playing because it's not what I was expecting, especially if it's still fun and enjoyable! Too all of the Naruto fans out there- Game on!

reviewText:
Hello there Steam users,

Okay, so I have always loved all the Naruto shows both Shippuden and before that and was excited about this game and getting it for my PC to adventure around. Well... I'm not thrilled about the game itself.

I paid about $45 - $50 (pre-order) and when it was released and had it installed on my laptop, I was disappointed by not only the difficulty of the game, but also the near inability to play it on a PC. It became clear to me that this game was meant for platforms and not a PC as the controls were straight from an XBox game pad complete with triggers and bumpers and finding the right keyboard strokes to play the game effectively proved trying and ultimately nonexistent.

This should have been re-worked to be of use to those that wanted to play the game on their laptop. I DO NOT recommend this game to anyone other than those wanting the console version.

~Jack Harkness~

reviewText:
Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja storm revolution is a much more improved version of its predecessor in the mechanics, Taking out the parts of the game that was unnecessary such as that hack and slash gameplay and putting in more emphasis on fighting, online play and balance of the game, while suffering problems with a lag at times. However, the game sacrificed most of its epic music, story, and cut scenes(except the mecha naruto storyline which has all this) features drawing fans right down the middle. Those who are looking for a game with new mechanics, more balanced system this is what this game is about. For those that wanted a story mode, it's better off to get fullburst. Both games, however, still seem to suffer from network problems though you are likely to get better connectivity in this one.

During the start of the game players will be able to browse four modes - Online battles, Ninja's world tournament, free battle, and ninja escapades.

The story mode of the game is ninja escapades. To understand the story of the game players will have to play the previous version full burst, read the manga, watch the anime or look for various resources to know exactly what is going on in the series itself otherwise, prepare to be dumbfounded in this series. The game has a seriously short story mode which had its story nicely picked and exclusive. However, can be beaten in 1 hour and 30 minutes making truly short and a letdown. However there is also a Mecha Naruto sidestory in the ninja tournament mode which seems to be the main story line in the game. Previous fan looking for more of the story that is canon will be disappointed to find there is almost none in this version of the game and gone are those epic sequences and music like in fullburst.

The ninja tournament mode is a single player vs three other CPU controlled characters in a free-for-all where the fight is a brawl type to knock each other and earn orbs to progress through a tournament ladder to obtain tons of unlockables such as costumes items, jutsus, ultimate jutsus, items, and cards.
Players will also be able to send out network clones and have it level up toearn items and xp along with battling other network clones that appear. The mode itself has nothing to do with the story on the anime but is filled with roaming gameplay, voiced mini events, lotteries, sub quests to unlock characters, mini games, and secrets to be found through orbs.
After winning the first ninja tournament mode the Mecha Naruto side story will open for a small adventure with a plot. As you progress in the ninja world tournaments more of the world opens up for more to explore and unlock.

Free for all is a mode to test and play with what is wanted so that new players can understand the combos and characters to find, which is the best combos for them along with getting the mechanics of the game down. There are 118 characters to choose from to mix and match along with one or two supports to choose from for each setup.

Online play also has an assortment of new options to choose from such as ranked, private matches, endless mode and ninja war mode are to name a few. Though the game is played through the network by who hosts and can sometimes be laggy making it truly hard to pull off some counterattacks and guard break if this happens, afterwards it just becomes a spam fest between who can hit what and to predict the future as moves are inputted 5-10 seconds later. If there is a good connection, then it gets really fun. The multiplayer seems to be much better in matching player's skill levels and latency but there is still the problem with lag and transmission EVERY TIME NOW.

The game itself, however, had its mechanics improved and that was the highlight here. The support system is reworked and evened out, There is a guard break mechanic in place along with a guard break item, and with a counterattack move to really change things up and help solved some of its imbalance. Before a fight players are able to pick from three different style type, UAD, (ultimate jutsu, awakening, or drive type) where the game lets players concentrate on one of the three aspects in the fight.
The game fighting is often more smooth on the inputs, and the game feels considerably more refined when played. This game is very easy to play and understand on the mechanics but very hard to master and takes some real skills when it comes to fighting others of different styles. Players will have to experiment with many combos to find the one that fits their style or the best ones. So yes, spammers and such can be beaten. The game was created to be fun to play and not really something to be taken too seriously as it is a game created for fun for anyone of all ages.


If you are a die-hard Naruto fan, this is a must-have for you, though if you are looking for the previous story mode that full burst offered you will not see that in this one because again it is focused upon the fighting mechanics, unlockables and online play(which is lagging nonstop). Otherwise wait for the price drop to make the purchase.

+ Graphics and moves are deeply flashy like the anime and felt truly cool to pull off.
+ Refined fighting mechanic that is easy to learn includes guard break and counterattack to help balance out the problems but very hard to master using these since they are about timing.
+ Includes Japanese language choice
+ has a world tournament mode to unlock items in and do special mini games for the collectionist
+ Fighting feels a lot more refined and fluid
+118 characters and two different support with a great amount of combination to create
+ Lots of unlockables, character aesthetic customization and secrets to unlock in the various modes.
+ Easy to learn, Fun to play, but hard to master. Not to be taken too seriously
+Mecha naruto story mode is different.

- No hands on tutorial for new players, but you can read from the menu and learn it since its easy.
- Ninja escapades story is short 1 hour and 30 mins, the mecha naruto seems to be longer.
- Network play depends on who is hosting, can be laggy at times well, most of the time its a lagfest and really unenjoyable because of this if you are matched with low pinged players OR maybe its the net code not sure but holy lag.
- If you get matched up with a pro, you're 90% guaranteed death lol unless you get lucky somehow
- For the price of 49.99, you'll have to be die hard, because this one is focused upon the fighting mechanics' online play, unlocks and ninja world mode. There isn't much to story mode this time around.
- The epic scores and events aren't in this version (Mecha naruto end battle was the only part)
- If you are coming into this game thinking its a serious and very competitive game, then you got it wrong.
- The lag is now unbearable online and a real turn off, as if every player is lagging I can turn on injustice or ssf4 fine without atrocious transmission or lag against other players.

review on twitch.tv/kenuty

reviewText:
This game is better than Storm 3 in terms of gameplay. It has been rehashed to the extreme. All of the spam characters have been nerfed and the game just plays better online altogether. Try and spam awakening, the other guy can spam ultimates or supports. There's a counter for every type of spammer.

The ninja world tournament. It's stupid, it uses the over-the-head battle royale thing that was in storm 3, i hated that garbage waste of time. Escapades? Also stupid, just watch the videos on youtube, not worth paying $40-50 for something you can watch for free.

There are like 5 new characters, but once again for $50, haha, no. The online lags over 9000, its horrible. If your playing with friends down the stree it works fine. But try playing with someoen in another country i dare you. It's worse than storm 3. In storm 3, the game would freeze with transmitting on your screen. this game chooses to not do that, but just give you input lag instead, which is worse because your online looking like a dumb â™¥â™¥â™¥ who doesnt know what he's doing because your subsitution is a whole second late.

I can say, once again the onine is VERY balanced, WAAY better than storm 3, if you can get it to work. I'm already bored of this game. Storm 3 is basically just free battle with more characters. It's storm 3 DLC worth $5. So unless you don't own Storm 3 already, don't buy this garbage.
But me being the die hard fan of Naruto that i am, I don't regret buying this game one cent. I kind of got what i expected to, minus the crap online mode. So maybe if your a fan you'll buy the game, but if you didn't care enough to preorder it, than it's probably because you were skeptical. Your skepticism was well placed,as this game is worthless. :)

reviewText:
Cons:
NO proper story mode, the Ninja Escapades is a mode that has three mini stories. (looks like all stories were told, only filling the gaps?)
Compared to last gen, this game is more like a DLC in my opinion...
You might say the tournament mode 4 ninja brawl is so darn nice, but it's just not for me.
Too much walking and talking cliche in tournament mode tho.
As a said above, I guess $49USD ($69AUD) might be a little bit overpriced? Think about other fighting games :)

Pros:
The battle scene in this gen is a lot BETTER.
With 100 playable & support characters, there are sure to be characters to fit everyone's play style.
New gameplay mechanics with the powerful combo ultimate jutsu and combined attacks, allowing characters to combine their power to create powerful techniques to defeat the enemies.
A brand new character (Mecha-Naruto) designed by Masashi Kishimoto exclusively for the game.
New ninja world tournament mode featuring 4 ninjas brawl and one gathering the most battle orbs wins.

Conclusion:
If you are only into the fighting part of the game, I would defintely recommend you to pick this one up!
But, if you are a person like me focus more on the story mode, you might be disappointed ;'(


P.S. If you don't have the previous generation STORM 3, go for it now, you won't regret it!

reviewText:
Pros: The best in the series as far as combat and character selection goes. More characters then previously avaliable in any storm title. Both faces from the past and present are in Revolution. Ninja World Tournament has a nice presentation to it. It's your only real chance to experience a little open world in this game. Take any of the characters from the roster and compete in 4 fighter battle-royale going from rank D to rank S competition building your own story a long the way.

Cons: There is not real story mode here. Generations 2.0 is pretty much what you get. There are a few side/back stories, also the  Mech-Naruto fantasy story that are basically your equivalent to filler episodes. So don't expect to see the grand finale of the Fourth Great Ninja War in this title. Outside of it's lack of story this game has no outstanding flaws.

Rating: 8.5/10
Final Thoughts: If Storm 4 comes and the game is exactly the way it is here in Revolution but with a story mode you got a 10/10 for Naruto and anime lovers a like. I give it an 8.5 due to the fact that it's a filler in disguise, but we all knew that coming in. Fans of the series won't be disappointed. Lets just hope Storm 4 hits early next year or heck even this holiday season would be epic!

reviewText:
Okay this is tough coming from a fan, but I'll tell you the truth about this game. This is not a bad game, and I say that with honesty. This game is a testamony to laziness, slacking on the devs side, its not innovative, and worst of all it's a cash grab. I would not pay full price for this game if I were you. If you want this game rent it or whatever, but don't buy it until it goes on steam sell or something.

The problem with this game is that it is full burst 3, but with some new characters, and anime cut scenes. There is basically no story in the game, and they try to sell you on this tournament which you will get bored of, and they also try to sell you on this robot naruto. This I guess is one of the selling points, but his story is EXTREMLY unintresitng, and I doubt anyone wanted a game just for a robot naruto anyway.

Another problem is this 100+ characters deal. They advertise this game and say we have over 100 playable people, but 6 of those guys are Sasuke, 4 or 5 are Naruto, 2 are the first hokage, 3 or Obito actually 4 is you count him as a child, and the list goes on. I really don't get it because they made 3 different Madaras one character. This is very lazy because I mean over half these characters were in full burst, and they had the exact same moves + special. Also I guess to be fun or balanced you have to choose to be in awaken mode or special mode, and I personally think they should be more of a choice and not either or. I get it is to balance the game, but it is a step back if I am playing as naruto and I can't do my special just because I can awaken or vice versa. I think they could have ismply made more complicated controls because well its a fighting game!

If you've played full burst 3 you have basically played this game, and there is your story. There is no ninja time line or anyhting, so save your money. There is no point to this game other then its a new naruto game, and I'm sure next year they will make a new one because the series has not even ended this year. Next year they will probably do it right and give you a story, real full characters, and leave this tournament stuff for an extra mode like free battle or something.

There is no story, there are too many copy cat characters, the ninja tournament gets boring FAST, and  mecha naruto is pretty uninteresting as a character and in his story.

Final line:Game is full burst 3 50 bucks add-n and out of 10 I'd give this game a 3.5 maybe 4, but 3.5.

reviewText:
For the 4th Part of the Series i would say 6/10
Mostly cause the maintheme in this part is the Ninja World Tournament which u play again and again and again and again through every rank from D to S+ Rank and its pretty much everytime the same (except for the S+ where all of ur enemies are allready in the awekening mode which is pretty annoying)

For the Normal Tournament Fights u will fight against 3 other cpuÂ´s to get the most orbs, every fighter starts with 1000 orbs and ull have to beat em out of them which seems like a pretty cool new idea  . . . . . *thinking about it* . . . . . or NOT
Cause the main problem in this fights is that if u got the most orbs each Fighter will turn against u to get ur orbs and u cant compete with all at the same time especially when there is:
-Rails which u can slide on and do attacks (some of them are pretty much useless ive noticed, depends on ur char)
-Bombs/Traps where u or the enemy can walk/get thrown in and get blasted of
-Some kinda chests which contains more orbs
-2 Special orbs which gives u either an Ultimate Jutsu or the Awekening mode (had many situations where i got them but couldnt activate them cause it was not possible to do anything at all)
-The Orbs which u had or got beaten out of u or the others and to Top it all of there are Random Support Troups ( like Gamakichi-big frog, Anbu-other ninjaÂ´s, Kazuyu-big snail . . . and so on) who are doin ninjutsu all over the place.

At some points its just a BIG MESS with so many things everywhere that ull have to be aware of and against 3 (+random troup) enemies with ninjutsu flying all over ull sometimes face the situation wher u can do absolutely nothing and it gets Frustrating.
For me this mode was no fun at all cause i personally think this mode was not well conceived.

For the other Modes of the game, i like that they added more modes for the Free Fights Section where u can play local tournaments with friends or survival against the Cpu,
the Ninja Antics are nice and its kinda whatching the Anime cause they added some backround story about some Chars which u havent seen so far in the Anime but its pretty short like 1-1 1/2 h
Mecha Naruto Story is okay but not that much content to it
for the Online mode its pretty much the same as in part 3 of the series, played some matches against others and friends online and the Connection was very stable, no lags, no disconnects. u got one new thing in online mode and that is the Network Double which u can Style and train so he can get random encounters with other players but thats it.

Overall they fixed some issues from the 3rd part and it looks better than its predecessor and thats what i love about the game in the end, playing some matches with some friends and it looks and feels very good.
Played all four games so far 1-2 on ps and 3-4 on pc
I really like the Anime and the games are pretty well made but if u are a fan of Naruto and like to play the whole story of the Anime than i would suggest u go and buy the 3rd part of the series cause its AWESOME.

reviewText:
I should probably preface this with the fact that this is the first Naruto fighting game I've bought since Clash of Ninja 2 for the Gamecube. I can safely say these games have certainly come a long way since then.

Story:
The game has its own story that it follows; think filler episodes in the anime. There are two story modes in the game: the Ninja World Tournament's mecha Naruto, and the stories in Ninja Escapades. The cut scenes in Escapes were done in the same style as the show and sheds some light on a few areas not covered in the show or manga. I did find it to be a little too short, only taking a couple hours to get through. Though in the game's defense, there isn't much more new canon left that it could have followed and what there is will likely be for a later game.

Sound:
Being able to pick between English and Japanese versions for the voiceovers is a great option to have. Everyone has their own preference between the two version of the show. However, the music is probably the area I found myself being the most disappointed in. The soundtrack doesn't offer much in terms of variety; I was often just listening to the same few tracks over and over again. After a few hours of gameplay, I ended up just muting it and playing my own music.

Gameplay:
What do you think of when you hear Ninja World Tournament? Chances are the last thing that comes to mind will trying to be the one with the most orbs collected when the time runs out. While the four person, free-for-all style battles that take place in this mode can be difficult, I felt they were wasted being only used for nabbing orbs. The combo system is another area that felt lacking. To pull off combos in the game you use the b button and, depending on the combo, tilt the control stick up or down once.

Overall, I still found this a fun fighting game with a huge cast of characters to choose from. The different modes found under Free Battle help to add some variety and would certainly be fun to play against friends in. While the music certainly is disappointing, I wouldn't say it ruined the game. I recommend this if you're looking for a fan of Naruto and looking for a good way to kill some time.

reviewText:
It is a spectacle fighter for the fans of a show with 500+ episodes so I'd think it would be pretty self-evident that people who are not fond of the show will probably not find anything of worth in this title as it's more about the characters than anything else.

If you like Naruto, though? This is basically as good as it gets! The combat is very flowing and challenging while at the same time being very flashy and rewarding in how intense the fighting feels (especially in the harder levels). The story-mode in this version isn't much to write home about but the game makes up for that fact with the huge character roster.

The game looks good, runs fairly well (your milage may vary but I haven't run into any issues or bugs during my ~30 hours of play) and is very fun to play if you have any love at all for the characters in Naruto.

This is a definite buy for Naruto fans but it's hard to recommend it to anything other than fans of the show.

reviewText: Disappointed
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I've owned every Naruto game for a few years now, and I will say that combat-wise, (like when you actually are 1-v-1 with someone), this is probably my favorite, but I feel like I got more fun out of most of the iterations before this one. I'm a huge fan of its immediate predecessor, and even considering this is the newer game, I would pay MORE for Shippuden 3: Full Burst than I would for this game.

The story-related mode for the Akatsuki and Shisui was very very entertaining.. for the approximately 30 minutes it takes to beat it.

Mecha-Naruto, I would pay to have never seen that thing. I hated every minute of it, and cursed my completionist nature that I actually played it all the way through. Could have gone with a Sasori puppet, an Orochimaru bio-creation/clone, a Pain Nagato controlled body, but no, they went for a full arc of an android... in a canon that doesn't even feature cars outside of the movies... they went android. And this story is the LONGEST story segment in the game, BY FAR.

The four person tournaments are... okay. They're more of a mini-game than anything I'd actually want to be the focus of my tournament, and that's exactly what it is, the focus. Every level of the tournament is exactly the same. Even the voice-work of the announcers, at EVERY level is exactly the same. I was expecting at least some custom dialogue for beating the top level, even if not character-specific words. The only thing that changes at all is the mini-quests, and we all know how fun fetch quests are.

As per characters:
I was a bit disappointed in Kushina's character, I was expecting her chain attacks and actual ninjutsu.. I got a frying pan.
Konohamaru is fine, no complains there. I wouldn't say he's outstanding, but he's perfectly adequate.
Iruka, they did as much as they could with, he's not very well-developed as a fighter in the series, so fine enough there.
Shisui, great work, by far the best new character in the game, maybe overpowered even, but I can run with that.
The reanimated kage from Storm 3 are now playable... still not sure why they weren't in Storm 3. (Maybe this game really needed the leg up), they're mostly clones except for the Mizukage who has some very annoying attacks to go against.

Other additions:
I like the team setup of this game, especially having the unique finishers for a correct grouping of characters was really fun to explore and discover. Though there are several teams I'm really surprised have no special combos, it's still a great feature.

The online elements with sending out your bot to train is kind of cute, I liked that, but it's not really a huge draw that sets the game any higher either.

Overall, this is MUCH more like a sequel to Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm: Generations than it was a sequel to Storm 3. No epic boss fights, almost no story, straight out fighting and the 4 man minigame.

For context, I'd go:
Storm 3: 96
Revolution: 70

I bought this game pre-release... won't be making that mistake again. If you're buying a Naruto game, buy Storm 3: Full Burst. Cannot too strongly emphasize that.

reviewText:
Do not, under any circumstances, purchase this. STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!

The previous game, Full Burst, was genuinely good and solid, so I had high expectations waiting for the Revolution.
They were shot down in flames.

The game has no story mode, only that filler-ish Tournament with the mecha-thingy, taken straight from one of the most â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, canon-twisting and ugly filler episodes.

The game has A LOT of playable chars, which is great, especially for the online mode. Basically, the only part truly worth playing would be the online mode.

And here we have tiny little proble,

ONLINE MODE IS BLODDY UNPLAYABLE.

For many players, it has increcible, insufferable and unfixable lag. It starts even before an online match, in the online menu. I got this game to play with a friend who lives very close to me, in the neighbouring city. We both have good PCs and good net connections. We were really looking forward to playing the Revolution. Still, it was unplayable.

I tried using a number of tweaks and fixes found online, to no avail. There are no patches, the devs are silent, nobody gives a damn. Nice way to treat your customer base. Hey

reviewText: Fun fighting game featuring the cast of the Naruto Franschise. The fighting system is one of the most fast and frantic that I've ever played and perfectly translates from the manga and show battles that we have seen and read. The Story mode in this one is non-existant and is replaced with a tournament mode of sorts. But the Online battles and challenges are fun to test your skills and get familiar with each of the characters. Speaking of which, the characters are nice and varied and all have their own play styles. If you aren't familiar with the Naruto characters, but looking to try a new fighting game with a different combat system that isn't limited to 2-D, Then consider this one!

I thought that it would be fixed for Naruto Shippuden Ulimate Ninja Storm Revolution... However it wasn't. I changed the voice system to Japanese and sure enough there is no audio coming from characters, however all the backround audio works. I beg the creators of this game to release a hotfix, because as of right now I have zero audio outside of the title screen.

reviewText:
Pros: The character selection is amazing and the little bit of story you get out of it is entertaining.

Con: There is no story mode. Like none at all. There are a few mini storylines that I cleared in about 45 minutes and they were mainly cutscenes.

Overall I would recommend this game because the combat system is amazing like it always has been in other Naruto games and it is a lot of fun. Unfortunately I was really looking forward to a story mode because I actually enjoy the story in the Anime. Although there are various other modes that kind of make up for it, but the new 4 player battle royale style is not the greatest, it feels like a filler.

reviewText: I don't really know how to rate this game. It has the same great art style of Full Burst and the same battle stly with the addition of the Orb collecting battle. However, I was completely confused by the menu when I couldn't find a story mode only to find that the story was competing in the Ninja World Tournament over and over again which was rather disappointing as it had no real story behind it other than to be the best. The tournaments became extremely repetitive as soon as you reached the end of the C Rank tournament which was the 2nd playthrough. The Orb collecting 4 person battles were literally the only battles you did, there was no 1vs1 battles climbing where the winner climbs the ladder into the next round. like you'd see in an actual tournament . The online and free battles however did bring some fun into the game as you could do something else like team or single battles with a friend or by yourself. I'd still recommend the game. But not until it hits the sales for like Â£20.

reviewText:
Well this game compare to storm 3 i will say is not as good.
1. storyline, there is none. There is some side story and mecha naruto that in total adds up to maybe 1-2 hour.

There are however more characters and new tour mode. But I really feel like this is more of a DLC to Storm 3. the game is still nice but a little disappointing though.

reviewText:
The game itself has a good part and a bad one.
Good parts:
- You can play with almost every character on the shippuden series (even the dead ones)
- you can perform new jutsus when you select an specific group of characters (ex: when you choose the 3 Sannin, you can use a very nice ultimate jutsu)
- there are new stuff you can watch to understand even more the Naruto universe
- you can collect stuff so you have more things to do
- you can have a network clone and show everyone how good you can build a character using the items and combinations
- if you're tired from the story mode, you can freely battle with any character you want (as long as you play the game, you unlock more characters for free play)
- there are jobs and you must battle everyone to get characters to help you on battles
- the controls are easy to learn, and you can perform nice combos without having to smash every button on your controller/keyboard, which happens with a lot of games of this genre.
- it has exclusive new jutsus, like Minato's Flying Raijin: Jiku Shippu Senko Rennodan Zeroshiki

Bad:
- lacks performance during online battles (it is horrible, I mean, how can they manage to make it so stiff to play? I am a very addicted player, and I can have a good control of the battle. But when I tried the online mode, I got my butt kicked, because it was so sluggish that I could not perform a basic combo!)
- the orb system is boring and broken. You start playing, it's kinda ok. But when you get to rank S, it is REAL boring to play, because there are no new challenges, and the NPC enemy gang up on you, and all you get to do is to dodge all your way hoping who is attacking you get trapped or step on the traps you lay down.
- It is not a real story mode with last boss. Mecha naruto story has it, but anyway, you gotta play the boring orb battles first
- the characters characteristics does not match what you have on naruto universe.
- if you did not see the entire series, you will have a lot of spoilers. It is not really a bad one to consider, but you will be very disappointed when you begin to know something you are not supposed to.
- the drive and awakening battle type feels weaker than the ultimate combo one. I don't know if it is a personal issue, but ultimate jutsu battle type is much more easier to fight than the other types.


My final words: If you have played Naruto Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst, you will find out this one is REALLY BORING! Ok, we have new jutsus, a great improvement on avoidability mechanics (RT does the strafing), but no. I thought this was a good game until I played his antecessor full burst. And it made me very upset.

reviewText: Storm revolution is pretty much just filler/Fan service until Storm 4.  If you are looking for a campaign like Storm 3 where it follows the story, this is definitely not it.  The only story elements you get to play through are Mecha Naruto and the Akatsuki Background story which roughly takes a few hours. Storm is really just about fighting.  The fighting mechanics are a bit better though Drive seems to be a bit OP.  Tons of characters from the manga to pick from and combine with. I definitely like the Ultimate Combo Jutsus some are just too funny.\n\nI kind of like the Network clones you can make when you just want to play the tournament or free battle. Other than that. If you are a fan of Naruto, I highly recommend. If you are looking for more of a campaign type story like Storm 3, then you may want to hold off and wait for either a sell to get this or simply wait for Storm 4.

reviewText: Fun fighting game featuring the cast of the Naruto Franschise. The fighting system is one of the most fast and frantic that I've ever played and perfectly translates from the manga and show battles that we have seen and read. The Story mode in this one is non-existant and is replaced with a tournament mode of sorts. Speaking of which, the characters are nice and varied and all have their own play styles. If you aren't familiar with the Naruto characters, but looking to try a new fighting game with a different combat system that isn't limited to 2-D, Then consider this one!

reviewText: i have played nearly all the ultimate ninja storm games made. each one has followed the storyline of the manga/anime which has now come to a close. however after the end of ultimate ninja storm 3 the story wasn't finished and there was still another story to fit into a new game however. this game has decided not to follow that. either because they felt there wasn't enough story to dedicate to this game. or because they wanted to save that for another game to make more money by extending the life of this franchise. its ninja escapades are short and the last ninja escapade dosent even have a fight in it. its a single cutscene. its only redeeming features in terms of single player content is its ninja battle royal they took on the feedback that people liked the mob battles shown in the last game however they haven't made them feel anything like the old ones which is disappointing but they have took great measures with characters and the combat system allowing certain teams that are known to have a certain relationship in the manga to work well in game when paired. the awakening and ultimate jutsu system has been reworked. but in fairness none of these things really matter as Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolutions is a fighting game and fighting games are meant to be enjoyed with others so its multiplayer content that really is what we are here for. so its large list of characters and variations. its whole new ability to customise your favourite characters and save them to useful pallets to be quick selected in character selection. and something im especially fond of. the network clone system. it almost feels like your training a son to fight how you do and then stand in your absence against challengers. its combat is easy to learn. but at the same time hard to master. the synergy between characters is great. as iv already mentioned. and if you see nothing in this game to enjoy. just get it to appreciate the beauty of pulling of a 66 hit combo and killing someone in 12 seconds to brag to all your friends. this is a game to settle disputes. this is a fighting game. and i got it for its multiplayer. not for the story.

reviewText:
I enjoyed my time with this game. It's not the best fighting game I've ever played. Not even close. But the mechanics are nice enough to keep me happy. If you're looking for in depth combos and crazy button imputs this isn't the game. Everything is really simply and pretty quick to pick up. The big thing is in learning the best time to do different attacks and which ones lend themselves best to your play style. Once you figure that out you're pretty much set. Personally I started playing as Hinata and never looked back.

There are some downsides to the game, at least in my eyes. The things that you do in the game are the same thigns that you will be doing the entire game. They add in new mechanics to the four person fights from time to time, but really it's still using the same combos that you do while you're in a regular battle. That's fine though, I kind of expected that. The real problem here is with the online multiplayer. The lag completely kills that part of the experience. I know how to play the game at an okay level, but with the lag I input the dodge button and it doesn't happen. I try to load chakra and it just won't happen. It's frustrating to lose a battle mostly because your internet isn't quick enough. It's especially frustrating in a fighting game that requires quick reflexes. I played a couple of online matches and I'm not sure I would play any more of them. I really want to since that's the best part of fighting games, but with the input lag it just doesn't become fun for me.

If you're a fan of the games this one, or really any of the Naruto fighting games, is a good one to grab. If you're looking for a great fighting game then you might want to try something else.
